newsitem.title: UK: Granada up on newspaper, lehman comments.
newsitem.headline: Granada up on newspaper, lehman comments.

text.p: Shares in media and leisure company Granada Group bounced on Friday after the Daily Telegraph newspaper highlighted the stock's recent underperformance.
The shares were up 30-1/2p to 768-1/2p but were still well below their year high of 984p.
"The shares have been oversold," said one market-maker. "They've risen on the Telegraph's report which highlights their performance."
The newspaper's Questor Column noted that shares in Granada have fallen 24 percent from a peak four months ago and now look cheap.
On the restaurant and hotels side of the business, Ramzan noted that current buoyant consumer demand should also benefit the business and worries over the soaring pound had little impact on Granada.

"Granada does not have a significant exposure to exchange rate factors but they are very exposed to a strong consumer," he said. "At twelve times earnings the stock looks very cheap against the rest of the sector and the market."
